required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial Comparing Efficacy And Safety Of Sunitinib And Capecitabine
clinical_study.official_title: Phase III Randomized, Multi Center Study Of Sunitinib Malate (SU 011248) Or Capecitabine In Subjects With Advanced Breast Cancer Who Failed Both A Taxane And An Anthracycline Chemotherapy Regimen Or Failed With A Taxane And For Whom Further Anthracycline Therapy Is Not Indicated

brief_summary.textblock: To compare efficacy and safety of Sunitinib and Capecitabine in subjects with advanced breast cancer who failed both a taxane and an anthracycline chemotherapy regimen or failed with a taxane and for whom further anthracycline therapy is not indicated

detailed_description.textblock: Patient enrollment in this trial was discontinued based on statistical assessment for futility. An independent Data Monitoring Committee found that even if the trial had been allowed to continue, treatment with single agent sunitinib would be unable to demonstrate a statistically significant improvement in the primary endpoint of progression-free survival compared with single agent capecitabine in the study population. Pfizer notified clinical trial investigators involved in the study and regulatory agencies of these findings on 25Mar2009. Patients receiving sunitinib will be allowed to receive capecitabine or enter an extension trial if they are receiving clinical benefit from continued sunitinib therapy. There were no safety concerns leading to the decision to terminate the study.

clinical_study.why_stopped: See termination reason in detailed description.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization to every 6 weeks thereafter through 22 months or until death
primary_outcome.description: Time from the date of randomization to the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occured first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization to every 6 weeks thereafter through 22 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Overall Response (OR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization to every 6 weeks thereafter through 22 months
secondary_outcome.description: OR was defined as the number of participants with confirmed complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST, Version 1.0) for at least 4 weeks, confirmed by repeat tumor assessments. CR was defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined as a greater than or equal to (>=) 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization to every 6 weeks thereafter through 22 months or death
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the first documentation of OR (CR or PR) that was subsequently confirmed to the first documentation of tumor progression or death due to any cause. CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined as a >= 30% decrease in sum of longest dimensions of target lesions taking as a reference baseline sum longest dimensions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization to every 6 weeks thereafter through 22 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to the first documentation of objective tumor response (CR or PR) that was subsequently confirmed. CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined as a >= 30% decrease in sum of longest dimensions of target lesions taking as a reference baseline sum longest dimensions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization until death
secondary_outcome.description: Average time from randomization to first documentation of death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) Quality of Life Questionnaire (EORTC QLQ-C30)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 of Cycle 1, then odd numbered cycles thereafter
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC QLQ-C30 scales: functional (physical/role/cognitive/emotional/social), symptom (fatigue/nausea/vomiting/pain), global health/QOL, cancer symptom (dyspnea/insomnia/appetite loss/constipation/diarrhea). Feelings in past week: response range: not at all to very much, global/QOL range: very poor to excellent. Scales/single-items averaged, score 0 to 100. Higher functional/global=better functioning and symptom=greater degree of symptoms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 of Cycle 1, then odd numbered cycles thereafter
secondary_outcome.description: BR23: measured disease related symptoms of dry mouth, eye pain, hair loss, hot flushes, attractiveness, future health, sexual activity, arm/shoulder pain, breast pain, swollen breast, and skin problems on the breast. Recall period: past week; response range: not at all to very much. Scale score range: 0 to 100. Higher symptom score implied a greater degree of symptoms.

arm_group.description: 1250 mg/m^2, twice daily, for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

intervention.description: 1250 mg/m^2, twice daily, for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- breast adenocarcinoma
- prior treatment with an anthracycline and a taxane either concurrently or sequentially in the neoadjuvant, adjuvant and or/ advanced disease treatment settings. No more than 1 chemotherapy regimen in the advanced setting
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior treatment with regimens of chemotherapy in the advanced/metastatic disease setting beyond those containing anthracyclines and taxanes or multiple anthracyclines/ taxanes treatments.
- Any prior regimen with capecitabine

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Capecitabine
group.description: 1250 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) or 1000 mg/m^2 in older participants, twice daily for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

group.title: Capecitabine
group.description: 1250 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) or 1000 mg/m^2 in older participants, twice daily for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: Time from the date of randomization to the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occured first.
outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization to every 6 weeks thereafter through 22 months or until death
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population: included all participants who were randomized.

group.title: Capecitabine
group.description: 1250 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) or 1000 mg/m^2 in older participants, twice daily for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: Time from the date of randomization to the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occured first.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population: included all participants who were randomized.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis is that PFS (median=4.2 months) for sunitinib arm equals PFS for capecitabine arm. The study was designed to have 90% power to detect statistical difference in PFS between two treatment groups assuming the hazard ratio (sunitinib/capecitabine) is 0.75 and both arms follow exponential distribution.
analysis.p_value_desc: 2-sided log-rank test with the same set of stratification factors. The set of stratification factors included those used in the randomization except study sites.
analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard ratio was calculated by the stratified Cox proportional hazards model.

outcome.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP)
outcome.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression.
outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization to every 6 weeks thereafter through 22 months

group.title: Capecitabine
group.description: 1250 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) or 1000 mg/m^2 in older participants, twice daily for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

measure.title: Time to Tumor Progression (TTP)
measure.description: Time from randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression.

analysis.p_value_desc: 2-sided log-rank test with the same set of stratification factors that was used in the randomization except study sites.
analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard ratio was calculated by the stratified Cox proportional hazards model.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Overall Response (OR)
outcome.description: OR was defined as the number of participants with confirmed complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST, Version 1.0) for at least 4 weeks, confirmed by repeat tumor assessments. CR was defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined as a greater than or equal to (>=) 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.
outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization to every 6 weeks thereafter through 22 months

group.title: Capecitabine
group.description: 1250 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) or 1000 mg/m^2 in older participants, twice daily for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

measure.title: Number of Participants With Overall Response (OR)
measure.description: OR was defined as the number of participants with confirmed complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST, Version 1.0) for at least 4 weeks, confirmed by repeat tumor assessments. CR was defined as the disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined as a greater than or equal to (>=) 30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DR)
outcome.description: Time from the first documentation of OR (CR or PR) that was subsequently confirmed to the first documentation of tumor progression or death due to any cause. CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined as a >= 30% decrease in sum of longest dimensions of target lesions taking as a reference baseline sum longest dimensions.
outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization to every 6 weeks thereafter through 22 months or death
outcome.population: ITT population. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with objective response. 27 participants in the sunitinib arm and 40 participants in the capecitabine arm reported CR or PR response and were analyzed for DR.

group.title: Capecitabine
group.description: 1250 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) or 1000 mg/m^2 in older participants, twice daily for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

measure.title: Duration of Response (DR)
measure.description: Time from the first documentation of OR (CR or PR) that was subsequently confirmed to the first documentation of tumor progression or death due to any cause. CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined as a >= 30% decrease in sum of longest dimensions of target lesions taking as a reference baseline sum longest dimensions.
measure.population: ITT population. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with objective response. 27 participants in the sunitinib arm and 40 participants in the capecitabine arm reported CR or PR response and were analyzed for DR.

outcome.title: Time to Tumor Response (TTR)
outcome.description: Time from randomization to the first documentation of objective tumor response (CR or PR) that was subsequently confirmed. CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined as a >= 30% decrease in sum of longest dimensions of target lesions taking as a reference baseline sum longest dimensions.
outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization to every 6 weeks thereafter through 22 months
outcome.population: The study was stopped early for futility and TTR analysis was not performed.

group.title: Capecitabine
group.description: 1250 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) or 1000 mg/m^2 in older participants, twice daily for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

measure.title: Time to Tumor Response (TTR)
measure.description: Time from randomization to the first documentation of objective tumor response (CR or PR) that was subsequently confirmed. CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined as a >= 30% decrease in sum of longest dimensions of target lesions taking as a reference baseline sum longest dimensions.
measure.population: The study was stopped early for futility and TTR analysis was not performed.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: Average time from randomization to first documentation of death due to any cause.
outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization until death

group.title: Capecitabine
group.description: 1250 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) or 1000 mg/m^2 in older participants, twice daily for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS)
measure.description: Average time from randomization to first documentation of death due to any cause.

analysis.p_value_desc: 2-sided log-rank test with the same set of stratification factors that were used in the randomization except study sites.

outcome.title: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) Quality of Life Questionnaire (EORTC QLQ-C30)
outcome.description: EORTC QLQ-C30 scales: functional (physical/role/cognitive/emotional/social), symptom (fatigue/nausea/vomiting/pain), global health/QOL, cancer symptom (dyspnea/insomnia/appetite loss/constipation/diarrhea). Feelings in past week: response range: not at all to very much, global/QOL range: very poor to excellent. Scales/single-items averaged, score 0 to 100. Higher functional/global=better functioning and symptom=greater degree of symptoms.
outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 of Cycle 1, then odd numbered cycles thereafter
outcome.population: The study was stopped early for futility and EORTC QLQ-C30 analysis was not performed.

group.title: Capecitabine
group.description: 1250 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) or 1000 mg/m^2 in older participants, twice daily for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

measure.title: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) Quality of Life Questionnaire (EORTC QLQ-C30)
measure.description: EORTC QLQ-C30 scales: functional (physical/role/cognitive/emotional/social), symptom (fatigue/nausea/vomiting/pain), global health/QOL, cancer symptom (dyspnea/insomnia/appetite loss/constipation/diarrhea). Feelings in past week: response range: not at all to very much, global/QOL range: very poor to excellent. Scales/single-items averaged, score 0 to 100. Higher functional/global=better functioning and symptom=greater degree of symptoms.
measure.population: The study was stopped early for futility and EORTC QLQ-C30 analysis was not performed.

outcome.title: EORTC QLQ Breast Cancer Module (BR23)
outcome.description: BR23: measured disease related symptoms of dry mouth, eye pain, hair loss, hot flushes, attractiveness, future health, sexual activity, arm/shoulder pain, breast pain, swollen breast, and skin problems on the breast. Recall period: past week; response range: not at all to very much. Scale score range: 0 to 100. Higher symptom score implied a greater degree of symptoms.
outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 of Cycle 1, then odd numbered cycles thereafter
outcome.population: The study was stopped early for futility and EORTC QLQ Cancer Module (BR23) analysis was not performed.

group.title: Capecitabine
group.description: 1250 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) or 1000 mg/m^2 in older participants, twice daily for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

measure.title: EORTC QLQ Breast Cancer Module (BR23)
measure.description: BR23: measured disease related symptoms of dry mouth, eye pain, hair loss, hot flushes, attractiveness, future health, sexual activity, arm/shoulder pain, breast pain, swollen breast, and skin problems on the breast. Recall period: past week; response range: not at all to very much. Scale score range: 0 to 100. Higher symptom score implied a greater degree of symptoms.
measure.population: The study was stopped early for futility and EORTC QLQ Cancer Module (BR23) analysis was not performed.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an adverse event (AE) and a serious adverse event (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one participant and as nonserious in another participant, or one participant may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Capecitabine
group.description: 1250 milligrams per square meter (mg/m^2) or 1000 mg/m^2 in older participants, twice daily for 2 consecutive weeks, followed by a 1-week rest period and given as 3-week cycles

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Due to patient enrollment termination, PFS/OR/TTP/DR were done by investigator assessment due to lack of central review data and TTR/EORTC QLQ-C30/QLQ BR23 analyses were not done. Those enrolled could receive capecitabine or enter an extension trial.
